name: Monkey Bread
ingredients: 3 pkgs refrigerated biscuit dough ½ c. margarine or butter
1 c. white sugar 1 c. packed brown sugar
steps: Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease bundt pan.
Mix white sugar and cinnamon in a plastic bag. Cut biscuits into quarters. Shake 6-­‐8 biscuit pieces in
sugar cinnamon mix. Arrange pieces in the bottom of prepared pan. Continue until all biscuits are
coated and placed in pan. In a saucepan, melt margarine with the brown sugar over medium heat.
Boil for 1 minute. Pour over biscuits. Bake at 350 for 35 min. Let bread cool in pan for 10 minutes,
Cinnamon-­‐sugar mixture (about 1 cup sugar to 1-­‐2 tsp. cinnamon -­‐ you may need a little more)
It's good to make this an assembly line process. If you try to tackle it on your own, it could take awhile. First cut
the uncooked rolls into quarters. Dip in butter, and then cover in cinnamon mixture. Place evenly in a bundt pan
and bake for about 20-­‐25 mintue in a 350 oven. When done, place a large plate on top of the pan and quickly
about 20-­‐25 minutes in a 350 oven. When done, place a large plate on top of the pan and quickly turn it over,
making sure not to lose any sauce.
